revised_title: Description and Analysis of a Unique Sea Plant: Frutex Marinus Flabelliformis
tldr: Sir Hans Sloane describes a curious sea plant, Frutex Marinus Flabelliformis, found in various locations such as Tangier, Antigua, and Newfoundland. The plant has a woody basis with branches spreading like a fan, covered in a thin, tuberculated crust. Sloane discusses its similarities and differences with other corallines and mentions the works of John Bauhin, who was the first to describe it.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
